#Text=Police shoot dead suspect in Copenhagen attacks
#Text=Sunday , February 15 , 2015
#Text=Press on the scene at the cordoned-off Krudttønden .
#Text=Image : Kim Bach .
#Text=Police in Denmark have shot dead a man they believe was responsible for two gun attacks that killed two people in Copenhagen yesterday .
#Text=Police had kept a property in the Nørrebro district of the city under surveillance .
#Text=When the man returned to the property , they confronted him and shot him in the ensuing fire fight .
#Text=Jorgen Skov , a police investigator , said " nothing at this point suggests there were other perpetrators " than the man shot today .
#Text=Yesterday , he was allegedly involved in two shooting incidents in the city .

#Text=The first shooting took place in a café at the Krudttoenden cultural center which was hosting a discussion about blasphemy and free speech , relating to the attacks on the Charlie Hebdo magazine in Paris .

#Text=Swedish artist Lars Vilks , who organised the meeting , was subjected to death threats following publication of a number of drawings of the Prophet Muhammad . Vilks ' website says the event was timed to coincide with the fatwa placed on the British novelist Salman Rushdie .
#Text=The event also hosted Inna Shevchenko , an activist with the feminist protest group FEMEN .
#Text=François Zimeray , France 's ambassador to Denmark , attended the event .
#Text=He told reporters : " They shot from the outside [ and ] had the same intention as Charlie Hebdo , only they did n't manage to get in[ ... ]

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The second attack yesterday took place outside a synagogue in the Krystalgade area of Copenhagen .

#Text=The chief police inspector Torben Molgaard Jensen told reporters :  We assume that it 's the same culprit behind both incidents .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Helle Thorning-Schmidt , the Danish Prime Minister , said yesterday :  We feel certain now that it 's a politically motivated attack , and thereby it is a terrorist attack .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Lars Vilks in a statement to Associated Press said he believed the first attack was directed at him :

#Text= British Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg said : " Sickened by shooting at free speech event in Copenhagen .

column1: #Text=My thoughts are with the people of the city and country .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott said the Australian government  condemns the shooting at a free speech event in Copenhagen overnight " and " [ t]he thoughts of all Australians are with the people of Denmark and , in particular , the family of the victim who lost his life and the police officers injured in this brutal act of terror .
